p: Physical exergy is associated with pressure, temperature, enthalpy, and entropy, and it is defined as the work achievable by subjecting a substance to reversible physical processes from an initial temperature and pressure to the state determined by the pressure and temperature of the environment ( eq 19 ). This exergy can vary according to the state or behavior of the stream. For a stream that behaves as an ideal gas with constant C p , eq 20 must be considered, and for a stream in a solid or liquid state with constant C p , eq 21 must be considered. Chemical exergy, on the other hand, connects the chemical exergy of each compound, its composition, and the free energy of Gibbs; this exergy is defined in eq 22 . For a mixture, it is required to use eq 23 .
